title: ICE in incremental build: DepNode Hir should have been pre-allocated but wasn't,
body:
```
error: internal compiler error: src/librustc/dep_graph/graph.rs:688: DepNode Hir(contracts[ca37]::contracts[0]::Contract[0]::contract_cost[0]) should have been pre-allocated but wasn't.
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:637:9
note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys::unix::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace

  19: rustc::hir::Crate::visit_all_item_likes
  20: rustc_typeck::outlives::inferred_outlives_crate

  23: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl

  29: rustc::ty::query::plumbing::force_from_dep_node
  30: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green
  31: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green
  32: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_green
  33: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_green_and_read
  34: rustc::ty::query::plumbing::<impl rustc::ty::context::TyCtxt>::get_query
  35: <rustc_typeck::collect::CollectItemTypesVisitor as rustc::hir::intravisit::Visitor>::visit_item
  36: rustc::hir::map::Map::visit_item_likes_in_module
  37: rustc_typeck::collect::collect_mod_item_types
  38: rustc::ty::query::__query_compute::collect_mod_item_types
  39: rustc::ty::query::<impl rustc::ty::query::config::QueryAccessors for rustc::ty::query::queries::collect_mod_item_types>::compute
  40: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl
  41: rustc::ty::query::plumbing::<impl rustc::ty::context::TyCtxt>::get_query
  42: rustc_typeck::check_crate::{{closure}}::{{closure}}
  43: rustc::util::common::time
  44: rustc_typeck::check_crate
  45: rustc_interface::passes::analysis
  46: rustc::ty::query::__query_compute::analysis
  47: rustc::ty::query::<impl rustc::ty::query::config::QueryAccessors for rustc::ty::query::queries::analysis>::compute
  48: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl
  49: rustc::ty::query::plumbing::<impl rustc::ty::context::TyCtxt>::get_query
  50: rustc::ty::context::tls::enter_global
  51: rustc_interface::passes::BoxedGlobalCtxt::access::{{closure}}
  52: rustc_interface::passes::create_global_ctxt::{{closure}}
  53: rustc_interface::interface::run_compiler_in_existing_thread_pool
  54: std::thread::local::LocalKey<T>::with
  55: scoped_tls::ScopedKey<T>::set
  56: syntax::with_globals
query stack during panic:
#0 [type_of] processing `contracts::Contract::contract_cost`
#1 [inferred_outlives_crate] computing the inferred outlives predicates for items in this crate
#2 [inferred_outlives_of] processing `contract_manager::ContractManager`
#3 [predicates_of] processing `contract_manager::ContractManager`
#4 [collect_mod_item_types] collecting item types in module `contract_manager`
#5 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack
error: aborting due to previous error
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: rustc 1.36.0 (a53f9df32 2019-07-03) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
note: compiler flags: -C panic=abort -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib
```

Everyone on our team sees the same error after pulling a particular commit (or series of commits) from our Git repo. We get the same ICE in Rust 1.39.0.

It seems to be a change in our codebase that breaks incremental builds, if there are cached crates from prior to the breaking commit. If we `cargo clean` then the problem goes away (in all tested Rust versions: 1.36, 1.37, 1.39)
